channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 56 g Amount in Package: 56 g

item.title: Report X-2024051817
item.description:
Report X-2024051817

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 2 GLASS BOTTLE OF ISOPROPANOL ALCOHOL WAS FOUND TO BE CRACKED AND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.

item.title: Report E-2024060231
item.description:
Report E-2024060231

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer forklift operator misjudged the height of his forkblades and as a result struck and punctured a drum with them consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report E-2024060220
item.description:
Report E-2024060220

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Zep Driveway and Concrete PW was released from a 1-gallon plastic jug due to improper loading by terminal XHG. The release impacted trailer #3178394 with six boxes. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller. The caller refused ERTS assistance with the cleanup. The caller stated the impacted boxes would be placed into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum and one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060203
item.description:
Report E-2024060203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading a short pallet into a trailer the forklift operator did not realize the forkblades from the forklift were sticking out from the pallet they were loading and as a result when they went to place the pallet down they struck a drum with the protruding forkblades consequently puncturing it and contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum after it was repaired with drum putty.
